radiographic_examinations.findings: Bibasilar atelectasis, segmental intrahepatic biliary dilatation involving segment II and III of the liver, mild stranding around the common bile duct, mild enhancement likely due to recent procedure, normal caliber common bile duct, normal liver enhancement, patent main portal vein, moderate amount of stranding around the pancreas, thickened duodenum likely due to inflammation, normal pancreatic enhancement, no evidence of complication including no pseudocyst or thrombosis, normal spleen and adrenal glands, normal kidney enhancement and excretion, unremarkable small and intra-abdominal large bowel, normal appendix, normal caliber aorta, enlarged prostate with small amount of free fluid in the pelvis, no free air or lymphadenopathy.
